statement.p: In the figure below, the angles that appear to be right angles are in fact right angles. Lengths in the figure are given in units of yards.

Image DescriptionA closed shape with five straight sides, with its interior shaded, where four of its five sides are either horizontal or vertical. Beginning at the bottom left corner and moving to the right, the path around the shape starts with a side that is labeled 43 yards, then moving straight up, a side is labeled 35 yards, then moving diagonally up and left, a side is unlabeled, then moving to the left, a side is labeled 33 yards, and finally moving straight down, a side is labeled 59 yards, connecting back to the original starting point at bottom left.
What is the area of the shaded shape? Give your answer as a decimal number, and then choose the correct units from the dropdown menu.
What is the perimeter of the shaded shape? Give your answer as a decimal number, and then choose the correct units from the dropdown menu.
